result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Hoffmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J Hoffmann

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's probation revoked - sentenced to county jail/hoc on 5-4-16; unpaid court obligations of $886
on behalf of defendant filed by T.H.

Defendant Christopher J Hoffmann in court, in custody.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing recommendations given by State.  Defendant made statement to Court.   Court sentenced defendant on Ct. 1 to serve 9 months jail, with Huber for work and treatment.  Ct. 2 90 days jail, with Huber for work and treatment, concurrent to Ct. 1.  A civil judgment will be entered for all unpaid court obligations.  72 days jail credit.  Defendant requested a furlough to attend graduation.  Court denied the request.  9:40/9:57
Per a phone call from Attorney Klopp, he will is no longer representing Mr. Hoffman and therefore will not be attending the 5/4/16 SEHR Hearing.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 4, 2016 at 09:30 am.
filed by Probation Agent Joshua Champion
to defendant re: payment of atty fees.
Order for payment of attorney fees per statement submitted by Atty Klopp

Prior: W9212 Cty. Hwy. CS, Poynette, WI 53955 United States
and Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief filed by defendant/counsel

Defendant Christopher J Hoffmann in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1 and Ct. 2, Judgment to be entered, Court withholds sentence, probation 2 years, Ct. 1, $543.00 costs, AODA and comply, Domestic Abuse Counseling, absolute sobriety, 2 days jail, Jail start date 12/11/15  at 7:00 P.M., defendant to submit DNA Sample, Ct. 2, $343.00 costs AODA and comply, Domestic Abuse Counseling, absolute sobriety, defendant to submit DNA Sample, 2 days sentence credit,
and Notice of DNA and Witness List filed by  DA Jane Kohlwey
For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by  DA Jane Kohlwey
Discovery letter filed to Atty Klopp.   Filed by District Attorney Jane Kohlwey
Bail/bond hearing at 11-24-2015 03:00 pm

amending bond from no contact w/A.J.H. to no violent/abusive contact w/A.J.H, and her children, the bond condition of no contact w/A.J.H's residence at W10675 Airport Rd, Lodi, WI shall remain in effect
filed by atty Klopp - mail.

victim request to amend bond filed by Atty Long and A.J.H.

Defendant, Christopher J Hoffmann, appeared.  Court goes over Petition for Court Appointed Attorney with defendant, finds defendant conditionally indigent, appoints Attorney Roger Klopp, at the rate of $70.00 per hour, defendant to repay the county at $50.00 per month, commencing November 1, 2015

Defendant Christopher J Hoffmann in court, in custody by video with attorney Adam Raabe.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. waives reading of complaint, $5,000.00 sign bond,  no contact w/A.H. of any kind, no contact w/ her children, their residence, their workplace or their school, may have contact w/children if by 3rd party and children want to have contact, defendant may contact 3rd party to make arrangements w/children, maintain absolute sobriety, not be on premises where alcohol is sold for onsight consumption,  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Return date scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
